data.text: Anyone have any issues with Pathfinder Pro tires. I have had 2 with side wall blowouts. 1 tire had 2 rides 30 miles the second 5 rides 200 miles. Iâ€™m baffled as the reviews on these are great.

data.author: McKnight Whitney

data.text: I've got close to 5000 miles on my rear tires and it's still going strong. The front was only replaced due to a slow leak that sealant never quite plugged and I had a big race coming up. They've been the best wearing tires I've used yet and I often run them at 20-25psi on far rockier terrain than they were designed for
data.author: Eric Healy

data.text: Zero issues. Like literally lost no pressure throughout the entirety of a 200 mile gravel race through sharp rocks in Kansas 2 weeks agoâ€¦ and then have run them another couple hundred miles since I got homeâ€¦
data.author: Quint Stevenson

data.text: I slam mine overinflated and underinflated and pay no mind to rocks or debris with no tire destroying punctures.
data.author: Mikey Mutz

data.text: zero issues.... this has been my tire for years and I am super hard on them. I tried just about every tire out there before I started using Pathfinders. What pressure you are putting on them? Also what was the event that caused a sidewall blowout?
data.author: Sebastian Alvarez

data.text: no event just riding 55 pounds at 185lb rider
data.author: Jeff Dolfinger

data.text: I'm one 175... I ride 35psi in front and 40psi in the back. You are on the correct range fo 50-80psi. I would give them another shot and lower the PSI.
data.author: Sebastian Alvarez

data.text: I donâ€™t even like 55â€¦ to soft. 2 tires in 4 weeks? One tan wall one black â€¦ seems like a tire issue. Tubeless as well
data.author: Jeff Dolfinger

data.text: Strange... I have one bike with black the other with tan. Good luck! You will figure something out!
data.author: Sebastian Alvarez

data.text: 55 psi? 185 lbs? Tubeless? Ouch. My teeth and bones hurt just reading that. You ride them off-road that high? On-road that makes sense if its a pure road ride. I'll run mine that high.
data.author: Rob Beare

data.text: Your not the only one reporting this problem.
data.author: Norm Snyder

data.text: tell me more
data.author: Jeff Dolfinger

data.text: Sorry Jeff. My mistake. I was thinking of a different tire. As far as I know the Pathfinder Pro is a pretty good tire. Some say it doesn't do well on wet pavement, but you can't have everything I guess. Sorry for the mixup.
data.author: Norm Snyder

data.text: eh? Wow, I have put these tires on 8 different bikes for me and my family, and they are incredible. I'm 235#, I have been using them (and switched almost every one of my off-road/commuter/gravel bikes to them) almost since they came out. I wonder if you happened on a bad batch/lot or something?
data.author: Rob Beare

data.text: I've had great success with these tires. My first pair lasted for several thousands of miles. On my second set and going strong!
data.author: Russell H. Blanchard
